[Header]

Brenham Tex.
Dec 20 - 1880

[Salutation]

My dear Professor

Your excellent letter came
to "hand" by due course of mail -
Always glad to hear from you -
I thought at one time I would "strain
a point" & run down to Galveston during
the holidays - but it is a pleasure I must
forego - Impecuniosity - What a terrible
disease! has made "Countless thousands
mourn" - We close on Friday eve
next for one week - Wish I could
join you - Disappointments - sink
the heart of man, but the renewal
of hope gives consolation - But the
"renewal" - will it ever come?
Not in my time - Trust you will
have a good time - "Let the cat rest
in peace", is the most I can hope for -
What would I give tonight to have
again the only place I ever coveted
in the State!

[1880, Dec. 20] Well there is a state of future punishment some people may look out - Certainly, I scan Dr. S's big I & little diction in Joseph - So characteristic of the man! Our genius fails to express it - In a former note he spoke of our "great & good Gov" - I think that Something will "turn up" some where - Mark my prediction - Gen L is lecturing on the "Noachic Flood" - The earthquake shock of Nov 22 - 1879 came closer home - I suggest that he take the latter subject for his next theme - Southern pedagogues has been in a state of vassalage to the North from time immemorial - I feel that we ought to come up like "Little Men" - with our hands upon our mouths & both in the dust & acknowledge our inability - to manage our own affairs & have guardians appointed to look after our intellectual moral spiritual & financial interests "according to law"

[Header]

[1880, Dec. 20]

Our people did not lose their manhood
in the struggle from 61 to 65. Oh no. Just
lost their spirit that's all - What is
Hamlet with Hamlet left out? -
I move we sneeze when our masters
take snuff - How do you vote - "I"
I's have it - I move to make it
unanimous - Carried - Cela -
No news here - Hear much talk of
X mas trees - festivals - suppers &c -
I have no disposition to engage in
these merry scenes - "Logan remained
idle in his cabin" - May I not?
Give me a sketch of your trip to the
Island City - I know you will have
a "good time" - All is dark to me
now - No light this side the clouds
& they lower - it may be dark there too
May we both answer "present"
at that last roll-call

[Signature]

Your friend
J. T. Hand
